Package org.jtrim2.taskgraph

Interface TaskInputBinder

public interface TaskInputBinder
A TaskInputBinder is used by task node factories to define the inputs of the task node they create. An input is always an output of another task node. Inputs are declared by specifying the unique key identifying the node whose output is required as an input and using the returned TaskInputRef in the created task node action to retrieve the input. There is no limit on how many inputs a task node can have. It is also possible to create a TaskInputRef for the same task node multiple times. Each created TaskInputRef are independent (regardless if they reference the same node or not) and can be consumed exactly once.

Note: When a task node factory defines an input, it will force a new node with the given key to be created (if it was not already created). The node does not need to already exist.

Thread safety

The methods of this task are not thread-safe and may not be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

The method of this interface is not required to be synchronization transparent. They may only be used before the associated task factory returns the task node action it creates.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • bindInput

      <I, A> TaskInputRef<I> bindInput(TaskNodeKey<I,A> defKey)
      Declares that the task node action created will need the output of the task node specified by the given key. The returned TaskInputRef can be used to retrieve the output of that node. However, the returned TaskInputRef may only be called from the created task node action (during its execution), and not by the task node factory.

      Calling this method will also force the execution framework to create a task node with the given id, if such node does not already exist.

      Type Parameters:
      I - the type of the input required. This is also the type of the output of the referenced task node.
      A - the type of the input of the task factory of the node producing the input
      Parameters:
      defKey - the id identifying the node whose output is to be returned by the TaskInputRef. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the TaskInputRef which can be used by the created task node action to retrieve the output of the dependency. This method never returns null.

    • bindInput

      default <I, A> TaskInputRef<I> bindInput(TaskFactoryKey<I,A> factoryKey, A factoryArg)
      Declares that the task node action created will need the output of the task node specified by the given key. This method is simply for convenience to call the single argument bindInput. The default implementation simply delegates to the single argument bindInput.
      Type Parameters:
      I - the type of the input required. This is also the type of the output of the referenced task node.
      A - the type of the argument of the task factory of the node producing the input
      Parameters:
      factoryKey - the key identifying the task factory creating the dependency node. This argument cannot be null.
      factoryArg - the argument of the task factory of the node producing the input. That is the value returned by TaskNodeCreateArgs.factoryArg(). This argument can be null, if the task factory accepts null arguments.
      Returns:
      the TaskInputRef which can be used by the created task node action to retrieve the output of the dependency. This method never returns null.
      See Also:
      • bindInput(TaskNodeKey)

    • bindInput

      default <I, A> TaskInputRef<I> bindInput(Class<I> inputType, Class<A> factoryArgType, A factoryArg)
      Declares that the task node action created will need the output of the task node specified by the given key. This method is simply for convenience when the custom factory key is null.
      Type Parameters:
      I - the type of the input required. This is also the type of the output of the referenced task node.
      A - the type of the argument of the task factory of the node producing the input
      Parameters:
      inputType - the type of the input required. This is also the type of the output of the referenced task node. This argument cannot be null.
      factoryArgType - the type of the argument of the task factory of the node producing the input. This argument cannot be null.
      factoryArg - the argument of the task factory of the node producing the input. That is the value returned by TaskNodeCreateArgs.factoryArg(). This argument can be null, if the task factory accepts null arguments.
      Returns:
      the TaskInputRef which can be used by the created task node action to retrieve the output of the dependency. This method never returns null.
      See Also:
      • bindInput(TaskNodeKey)
